string.text:
%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] all Warsaw Pact rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]PSO (for Pritsel Snaipersky Optichesky, "Optical Sniper Sight") is a series of Soviet-made optical scopes produced by Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant (NPZ Optics State Plant). In common use since 1964 when it was introduced as a standard issue telescopic sight for SVD sniper rifle. The scope has been later adapted to assault rifles such as AK-74 or AN-94. Recognized for its durability, versatility and very well-designed reticule pattern featuring convenient range-finder scale. This particular type has 4.0x magnification rate, making it usable mainly for combat at long ranges. It is attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSO-1

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] all Warsaw Pact rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]The USP-1 sight (index 1P29) has an optical arrangement with a prism-erecting system. Sighting angles are set mechanically by turning the sight body relative to the weapon mounting bracket. Requires no batteries as it is tritium illuminated. The ranging scale at the edge of the sight's field of view provides a means to find visually the range of up to 1200 m of a target 1.5 m high.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSU-1

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2]all NATO rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]The Barska Electro Sight Multi Reticle Red Dot Sight AC10632 was developed in order to be the best product for anybody looking for a high quality sights. Can be mounted on NATO weapons and on AK-12.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2]all NATO rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a USMC-style reticule and features adjustable magnification.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]3.5x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]USMC

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2]all NATO rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Holographic sight for NATO assault rifles and submachine guns.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] automatic rifle Galil AR
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Optical sight for the Israeli IMI Galil rifle.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]SUSAT

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] all Warsaw Pact rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]The Kobra sight is an open collimator combat optic using a laser generated HUD to superimpose a reticle pattern onto a filtered lens. It is designed for engaging fast moving targets and targets appearing for a short period of time in close quarters and urban combat in various light conditions. It provides clear targeting from 104 lx to 10-2 lx (daylight, twilight and moonlight), one or two eye targeting. Effective when shooting from moving vehicles.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1] none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] OTs-14 weapon series
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Optical sight for the OTs-14 weapon series.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]4x34

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] all Warsaw Pact rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]The PSO-1M2-O1 features an extremely effective and useful height-based rangefinder for dual use, with graduated scales for both standing and prone figure estimation. The 400 meter Simonov height based gradient (choke style) rangefinder has a chevron for use with the 9x39 calibre rifles.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]4.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PSO-1-1

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] historic Russian rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Standard-issue telescopic sight of the Red Army in World War II and years after it, designed to fit infantry and precision rifles such as Mosin-Nagant or SVT-40. It features a fixed 3.5x zoom making it a good choice for long-distance combat. Like all Soviet designs, it is durable and effective, remaining in production and use to this day.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]3.5x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]average
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]PU

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] historic German rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]ZF-4 is one of the first telescopic sights ever created. Designed and manufactured in Germany during World War II, it was intended to provide regular infantry with the ability to fight at long distances. In the end, due to insufficient numbers produced, it has been primarily used by German snipers and elite combat squads. The scope is still in use since weapons it has been designed for are commonly available, hence it remains a relatively popular model in the Zone as well.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]2.0x
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]ZF-41

High performance red dot sight that provides an unlimited field of view, while eliminating obstruction and tunnel vision common to tube style scopes. The Railway series has a standard rail base pre-installed to allow the sight to be attached to most Weaver or Picatinny rail mounts or receivers.

 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]none (collimator)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]good
Cheap 2x magnification red dot sight for NATO assault rifles, submachine guns and on AK-12.

%c[ui_gray_1]Suppressor for 9mm pistols and submachine guns. An effective sound suppressor for calibre 9x18 weapons. It is very archaic and yet quite effective. Its body contains a tightly-packed roll of fine brass mesh. The front of the unit comprises a set of rubber wipes with calibre-sized holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used for close-combat engagements against lightly-armoured enemies and for assassinations.
 
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]very high

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 calibre weapons 
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Advanced rifle suppressor of US design and manufacture, which has apparently 'disappeared' from one of the US Army supply containers. It consists of hi-grade steel body filled with four extension chambers, followed by a series of Z-type titanium baffles. The unit almost completely reduces muzzle flash and considerably suppresses sound emitted when firing. It also requires minimum maintenance. Suppressors of this and similar types are commonly used on all smallbore Western-made rifles and remain in active service in Western armed forces.
 
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]medium

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] SVU rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]This specially designed three-chambered suppressor is not intended to completely silence the SVU rifle since the soldier would not be using subsonic ammunition. Its main purpose is to quiet and diffuse the noise enough to make detection by the enemy difficult. Its special feature is a very effective muzzle break placed on end of suppressor, capable of reducing recoil by about 40%. Above capabilities come at the cost of reduced muzzle velocity and thus significantly lower the weapon's damage output.
 
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sound suppression: %c[ui_gray_1]low
 
%c[ui_gray_1]SPECIAL:
 
%c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] enhanced recoil reduction

%c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] selected NATO rifles
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Detachable optical scope made specifically for NATO rifles. ACOG stands for Advanced Combat Optical Gunsights and refers to a family of firearm scopes produced by the Trijicon company. Scopes of this type are usually of high quality and have an internal tritium-based reticule illumination. This particular type has a modern 'trijicon' reticule pattern and fixed magnification of 2.0x.
 
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Magnification: %c[ui_gray_1]2.0x
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Condition: %c[ui_gray_1]very good
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Reticule pattern: %c[ui_gray_1]trijicon
